qas.question: When was the Treaty of Alexandropol sanctioned?
What city did current day Gyumri used to be called?
Who led the Soviet Eleventh Army?
When did the Armenian republic breakdown?
What year did Turkish nationalists seize the Armenian Republic?

context: In <a4_0>1920<a4_0/>, Turkish nationalist forces invaded the fledgling Armenian republic from the east. Turkish forces under the command of Kazım Karabekir captured Armenian territories that Russia had annexed in the aftermath of the 1877–1878 Russo-Turkish War and occupied the old city of <a1_0>Alexandropol<a1_0/> (present-day Gyumri). The violent conflict finally concluded with the Treaty of Alexandropol on <a0_0>2 December 1920<a0_0/>. The treaty forced Armenia to disarm most of its military forces, cede all former Ottoman territory granted to it by the Treaty of Sèvres, and to give up all the "Wilsonian Armenia" granted to it at the Sèvres treaty. Simultaneously, the Soviet Eleventh Army, under the command of <a2_0>Grigoriy Ordzhonikidze<a2_0/>, invaded Armenia at Karavansarai (present-day Ijevan) on 29 November. By <a3_0>4 December<a3_0/>, Ordzhonikidze's forces entered Yerevan and the short-lived Armenian republic collapsed.
